name: China Queries Online Trivia | Asian | 10 Questions

questions.explanation:
Huang He.

	The Huang He, or Yellow River, has been the source of much sorrow over the many year history of China. It floods quite often and sometimes robs millions of people of their livelihood.

questions.text: Which Chinese philosopher developed the 'Doctrine of Tyranicide'?
questions.explanation:
Mencius.

	Mencius said that if a ruler was not ruling benevolently, the people had a right to revolt.

questions.text: What was the name of the native Chinese revolution that toppled the Qing dynasty in 1911?
questions.explanation:
Xinhai.

	The Xinhai revolution led to the Chinese republic, briefly led by Sun Yat Sen.

questions.text: During the reign of the first Qin emperor, Shi Huangdi, the Chinese script was standardized. What was this script called?
questions.explanation:
Small Seal.

	With the small seal, all Chinese would begin to write with the same system, despite the various dialects.

questions.text: What was the name of the Manchu royal clan that ruled via the Qing dynasty?
questions.explanation:
Aisin Gioro.

	The last emperor was Aisin Gioro Pu Yi, also known as 'Henry' by his English speaking friends.

questions.text: In 601 A.D., during the Chinese Sui dynasty, the Qieyun, a standardized dictionary arranged by tone and rhyme, was created to standardize poetic and literary rules. Who created this dictionary?
In 1936, Chiang Kaishek was captured in what is now known as what incident?
questions.explanation:
Xi'an Incident.

	He was captured by former Manchurian warlord Zhang Xueliang, who wanted the nationalists to focus their military attention on the Japanese invaders, rather than the communists.

questions.text: Along with Chen Duxiu, who was the other founder of the Chinese Communist Party in 1919?
Which of the following is NOT true of the famous Chinese explorer Zheng He (Cheng Ho)?
questions.correct: He was not well accepted in other parts of Asia.
options: He reached the coast of Africa.
questions.explanation:
He was not well accepted in other parts of Asia.

	He was very well accepted in other parts of Asia, and tributary gifts were exchanged at a number of stops.
